div.l: Lo here our silủere / redy for to spende
This meller to the town̄ / his dought̉er sende
For Ale and brede / and rosted hem a goos
And bond hir hors / it shold nomore go loos
And in his owne chamber / he made a bedde
With shetes ⁊and wᵗith shalons / faire I spreed
Nought from his owne bed / ten foot or twelue
His doughter had a bedde / albe hir selue
Right in the same chambre by and by
It myght be no bett / and the cause why
There was no more romer herberwe in þᵉ place
Hem sowpen and speken them to solace
And dronken eủere strong Ale / at the beste
A bowte mydnight wente they to reste
Wele hath this meller vernisshed his hede
Full pale he was / for dronken ⁊and not red
He yexithe and he speketh / thorugh þᵉ nose
As he ware on the quake / or on the pose
To bedde he gothe / ⁊and wᵗith hym gothe his wif
As any Iay he light was an as iolyf
So was hir ioly whistle wele I wete
The cradyll at here beddes feet is I sett
To rokken and to yeve hir childe sowke
And whan that dronken was all in the crowke
To bedde went the dought̉er / right a noon̄
To bedde gothe Aleyn̄ / and also Iohn
There is nomore / hym nedeth no dwale
This meller hath so wysely bibbed Ale
That as an hors he snortethe / in his slepe
Ne of his tayle be hynde / he took no kepe
